ygData.subject: Re: Doctrine of Wizardry
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve often wondered about such situations when using a levitate type spell. I m not high enough level to use them as yet, but would this tactic be seen as an
ygData.messageBody:
I've often wondered about such situations when using a levitate type spell. I'm not high enough level to use them as yet, but would this tactic be seen as an exploit by Verant? They do take a strong dislike to fighting monsters that cannot hit you back. That's under a bit different context I guess, as they are usually dealing with quirks in the terrain. This deals more with smart/tactical use of the spell I would think. But there are some potentially frightening similarities.

Any idea what Verant's position is on this?

Trev

-----Original Message-----
From: p00pb0t [SMTP:poobot@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 6:30 PM
To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Doctrine of Wizardry

From: "p00pb0t" <poobot@...>

According to a Gnome Wizard I met last evening levitate does some other neat things like, cast it when on a high cliff, attack a beast and walk a good bit off the cliff. Guess who cant touch you now ;)



*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 5/19/99 at 4:15 PM Robin McCaig wrote:

>From: "Robin McCaig" <twister@...>
>
>You are right, Flight is listed in the doctrine of wizardry.
>We need a high level mage to get the two runes needed expulsion and
>attraction, i believe, and see what the result is.
>
>What good does the spell levitate do? If all it does is make you rise up a
>little it wont help you in battle or nothing.
>Thanks
>Twisterkahn
>Tarew Marr
